data.title: Asian food convenient price
data.text:
I like this restaurant... my favorites are the soups, lettuce wraps and mongolian rice. 
Do not forget to take your lucky cookies

data.title: Average take out Chinese food
data.text: Food was OK, very salty and on the expensive side.  Not my favorite place, would not recomend.  there are other places better

data.title: Good lunch
data.text: We had a good lunch. Everything was steaming hot and the different meals were all well done. I had the small Pad Thai, which I felt was quite large. They have the multi soda machine so there are plenty of different sodas and waters to try. We also had some good orange chicken and some honey seared chicken. The wait time was not long considering it was over a holiday weekend.

data.title: Good food, fast - approaches PF Changs
data.text: If you want PF Changs but you don't have one in town, try Pei Wei. Owned by the same company  -- it approaches the great food. The honey seared chicken is basically wonderful. I also get the Pad Thai a lot with chicken. Never a bad experience yet.

data.title: Will not eat here again
data.text: This location has declined. We have enjoyed eating here periodically over the last few years. Went last night and was really disappointed. Lo mein was like spaghetti with soy sauce. Very little chicken and no vegetables. Pad Thai was watery. Brown rice did not seem fresh.  Would not eat here again.

data.title: Terrible fast "asian" food
data.text: I have tried many times as some of my friends like it but the flavors and ingredients are obviously off. Hope I am not forced to eat there again.

data.title: Yuk !!!
data.text:
very disappointed with the food, horrible system for ordering.
Food is not presented nicely and is way over priced, tried it twice, won't be a third time.

data.title: Definitely a Miss
data.text: The use behind this place is a good one.  Fast, freshly made Chinese food with a few basic ingredients at a reasonable price but the implementation is poor.  The dishes were salty and not very tasty.  They could definitely improve with some training from more traditional Asian fast food chefs since the cooks here really did not appreciate how to prepare and properly season the dishes.  Definitely a place to avoid.

data.title: Absolutely filthy
data.text:
My daughter always likes Pei Wei, in any location, for their chicken teriyaki so we recently went to this one while visiting family in South Florida for the holidays.  I don't know what to say other than the condition of this place was shocking.  It was a total disaster inside to the point that I wanted to walk out.  There was not one clean table that was unoccupied in the whole restaurant.  I'd like to say I'm exaggerating, but sadly, I'm not.  Every empty table was covered in dirty dishes that had clearly been there for awhile.  In fact, we had to ask one of the employees to clear a table for us so we could sit.  He seemed annoyed, but did it.  The floors were just as disgusting as the tables covered with napkins, food, and other debris.  Where was the manager? How could anyone allow a restaurant to get to this condition?  Also there were no napkins or clean silverware; we had to use the takeout, plastic silverware packets which was fine with me as I trusted that more than anything they may (or may not) have cleaned.

The only reason this review is a 3 star rather than a 2 star is because the food was good, but eating in that mess caused me to lose my appetite and question the cleanliness of the kitchen.  I will never return to this location again.  There's a Pei Wei in Weston and Plantation that's not too far away from this location so if Pei Wei is what you want go to any of the other locations to avoid eating in filth.  Absolutely disgusting dining experience.

data.title: Nice food
data.text:
I've eaten there twice, had the caramel chicken and the peiwei both of them spicy and sweet. I liked better the caramel chicken because it comes with fresh sliced vegetables on top, also chunks of pineapple. On the side I had the brown rice which was ok to be brown.
service is just fine but the guy who brings your order is very nice. They have kids menu, I ordered the chicken lo mein but it was too sweet , in my opinion and my son agreed.

data.title: Dirty
data.text: This place was a mess. Way too long to get food (23 mins). The tables and floor were dirty and the bathrooms were a disaster. The food? So-so. Way overpriced for what you get.

data.title: Decent food at a fair price
data.text:
First I must say that I am not one for Chinese food however this does seem to be quite a hit with my kids. If you dine in prepare to order your food and take a seat as your food will be delivered to your table. It is a bit irritating that they deliver the foo d as it is ready rather than as a table so your table mate could be done with his or her meal before you get yours. 

The tofu and rice  and Kung Pao chicken is very good but we tried the new sushi rolls and were very disappointed. Take out often takes longer than quoted and the young staff seems a bit slow. The kids really enjoy the new coke dispenser which let's you choose from a few dozen different choices.  Be sure to grab a few fortune cookies on your way out.

data.title: Fast Food Chinese
data.text: The menu at this restaurant is quite sparse, there are just not enough items on the menu; if this were Chinese McDonalds, I could understand but it's not, so they need a larger menu. You order the items from their counter, then the waiters bring the items to your table (you get a number and the staff looks for the number on your table). The food is just not very appetizing, when compared with other neighborhood Chinese or Asian foods, however, it is very quick. So if you need to just stop by and get a quick bite, it's perfect, but definitely not a family sit down dinner place in my opinion.

data.title: Good quick bite
data.text: great place for a quick bite, clean place and friendly staff. If the service is slow ask someone to help you and they will..

data.title: Worth It for the Lettuce Wraps
data.text: I love PF Chang's lettuce wraps, but I don't love PF Chang's prices.  Pei Wei fits the bill!  The lettuce wraps were great as always.  I also had Chicken Kung Po that was very tasty.  My wife also enjoyed her Thai-style noodle bowl.  The restaurant was busy.

data.title: Corn syrup city  :/
data.text:
I went to Pei Wei once for lunch takeout and will never go again. The inside of the restaurant was nice enough, casual. I ordered the sweet and sour shrimp. The sauce was thick and the pineapple and veggies had no flavor. It seemed that none of the ingredients were fresh at all (maybe everything was frozen or canned). The sauce was what really turned me off. It just tasted like it came from a bucket and was highly processed.
I really hate giving one star to anyone, but I can't justify giving it two.

data.title: Average
data.text: Went there this weekend and food was decent. However this restaurant, although I frequent it, is not consistent. I can see both sides of the reviews. I too have had the wonton soup and it was TOO salty. I did bring it to their attention. Don't know if it is the change in cooks or what, but I can only give it average because it is inconsistent in quality when I go their to eat.

data.title: Flu season got you down
data.text: Friday afternoon and we were both in the middle of a bad cold with no appetite and no desire to start cooking at home so I decided to stop at our local corner which features a number of small eat-in or carry out restaurants.  Chicken soup is always at the top of food items recommended for cold sufferers and I ordered  2 bowls of what they call Thai Wonton Soup.  Mistake. The soup was tasteless and salty with small manufactured wontons in abundance.  Its probably not fair to judge a restaurant on the basis of one item but this restaurant is part of a large successful chain and they should be ashamed to present this item as part of their menu.  I spent $10 for something I threw away.

data.title: A decent Asian quick serve restaurant
data.text: If you are looking for some quick Asian food and if you don't mind chain restaurants this Pei Wei franchise is probably a best bet for you. The food is very decent, although Korean beef they serve is a little bit too salty for me. This place offers food and drinks at affordable prices, and the servings are generous. The food is not as good as with their parent company (PF Chang's) but it also costs less. This is a good restaurant that with some changes in menu and appearance may become excellent one day.
